intro: Anchusa linearifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of small, sky-blue to white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Anchusa linearifolia is part of the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its medicinal and ornamental plants. Its structure and growth habits make it a hardy perennial suitable for xeriscaping and coastal gardens.
